channel.title: Garfield County|Utah|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Garfield County|Utah|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: UT-95 West at UT-276
item.description: UT-95 west at UT-276 to Ticaboo. Continue west on UT-95 for Blanding.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-20 West
item.description: US-89 North at UT-20 West to Beaver. Continue north on US-89 for Circleville and Richfield.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching UT-20
item.description: US-89 north approaching UT-20 west to I-15.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-143
item.description: US-89 north at UT-143 south. Turn left for UT-143 south to Cedar Breaks National Monument, Brian Head, and Panguitch Lake. Turn right to continue north on US-89 to Richfield and Salt Lake City. UT-143 is part of the Utah’s Patchwork Parkway National Scenic Byway.

item.title: US-89 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-89 north. Distance to Panguitch, Richfield, Salt Lake City, and Capitol Reef National Park.

item.title: UT-12 West Approaching US-89
item.description: UT-12 west approaching US-89. Use US-89 south for Kanab and Zion National Park; use US-89 north for Panguitch.

item.title: UT-12 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on UT-12 west. Distance to Cannonville, Tropic, and Bryce Canyon (National Park).

item.title: UT-12 West - Summit
item.description: Summit - Elevation 7600 Feet on UT-12 west in the Dixie National Forest.

item.title: UT-12 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on UT-12 west. Distance to Escalante, and Bryce Canyon National Park.

item.title: UT-12 West - Burr Trail Jct.
item.description: UT-12 West at Burr Trail Jct. Turn left for the Burr Trail to the Circle Cliffs. Turn right to continue west on UT-12.

item.title: UT-143 - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on UT-143 south. Distance to Cedar Breaks National Monument. Below distance marker is another sign reading Snow Plowing Daylight Hours Only.

item.title: UT-143 South - Garfield County
item.description: Large UT-143 south shield outside of Panguitch in Garfield County. There are quite a few of these oversized shields outside of Panguitch on UT-143 southbound.

item.title: UT-143 South - This is not US-89
item.description: This is not US-89 sign on UT-143 south. US-89 southbound traffic in Panguitch who do not turn left at the stoplight in town will end up on UT-143. This sign notifies travelers that they are not on US-89. There are also many oversizes UT-143 signs on the first few miles out of Panguitch as a reminder as well.

item.title: UT-143 - Truck Restrictions
item.description: UT-143 not recommended for trucks over 26,000 GVW. UT-143 is a steep, winding mountain road over the Markagunt Plateau.

item.title: UT-143 South - Snow Plowing Hours
item.description: Snow Plowing Daylight Hours Only on UT-143 south. UT-143 south is a very mountainous road that goes over the Markagunt Plateau.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-143
item.description: US-89 north at UT-143 in Panguitch. Turn left for UT-143 south; right for US-89 north.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-143
item.description: US-89 north at UT-143 south. Turn left for UT-143 south to Cedar Breaks National Monument, Brian Head, and Panguitch Lake. Turn right to continue north on US-89 to Richfield and Salt Lake City. UT-143 is part of the Utah’s Patchwork Parkway National Scenic Byway.

item.title: US-89 South at UT-143
item.description: US-89 south at UT-143 in Panguitch. Use UT-143 south for Cedar Breaks National Monument, Panguitch Lake, and Brian Head. Turn left to continue south on US-89 towards Bryce Canyon National Park and Kanab. UT-143 is part of Utah’s Patchwork Parkway National Scenic Byway.

item.title: US-89 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-89 south. Distance to Panguitch, Kanab, and Phoenix (Arizona).

item.title: End UT-20 East at US-89
item.description: End UT-20 east at US-89 at Bear Valley Junction.

item.title: End UT-20 at US-89
item.description: End UT-20 East at US-89. Use US-89 north for Circleville; use US-89 south for Panguitch and Kanab.

item.title: End UT-20 East at US-89
item.description: End UT-20 East at US-89 at Bear Valley Junction.

item.title: UT-20 East Approaching US-89
item.description: UT-20 East approaching US-89 at Bear Valley Junction.

item.title: UT-95 West at UT-276
item.description: UT-95 west at UT-276 to Ticaboo. Continue west on UT-95 for Blanding.

item.title: UT-95 West Approaching UT-276
item.description: UT-95 west approaching UT-276 in Garfield County.

item.title: UT-95 East - Colorado River
item.description: Colorado River crossing on UT-95 east. This is the backwaters of Lake Powell.

item.title: UT-95 East at UT-276
item.description: UT-95 east at UT-276 junction.

item.title: UT-95 East Approaching UT-276
item.description: UT-95 east approaching UT-276. Continue east on UT-275 for Hite Crossing, Lake Powell, and Blanding. Lake Powell can also be accessed via UT-276, and can be crossed via ferry.

item.title: UT-95 East Approaching UT-276
item.description: UT-95 east approaching UT-276. Turn right on UT-276 for Ticaboo; continue ahead on UT-95 for Blanding.

item.title: End UT-12 West at US-89
item.description: End UT-12 west at US-89. US-89 south is signed as a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: End UT-12 West at US-89
item.description: End UT-12 West at US-89. US-89 south is signed as a Utah Scenic Byway.

item.title: UT-12 West Approaching US-89
item.description: UT-12 west approaching US-89. Use US-89 south for Kanab and Zion National Park; use US-89 north for Panguitch.

item.title: US-89 North - Garfield County
item.description: Entering Garfield County on US-89 north.

item.title: UT-12 East at UT-63 South
item.description: UT-12 at approaching UT-63.

item.title: UT-12 East Approaching UT-63
item.description: UT-12 east approaching UT-63.

item.title: UT-12 East Approaching UT-63
item.description: UT-12 east approaching UT-63 south to Bryce Canyon.

item.title: US-89 North at UT-12 East
item.description: US-89 north at UT-12 east. UT-12 is marked as a Utah scenic byway.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching UT-12 East
item.description: US-89 north approaching UT-12 east to Tropic. Use US-89 north for Salt Lake and Panguitch.

item.title: US-89 North Approaching UT-12
item.description: US-89 north approaching UT-12 east to Bryce Canyon.

item.title: End UT-12 West at US-89
item.description: End of UT-12 at US-89 near Panguitch. Utah Scenic Byway follows US-89 south.

item.title: UT-12 - Sevier River Near US-89
item.description: Seiver River bridge nearing the western end of UT-12 near Panguitch.
